channel.title: The Straits Times Singapore News
channel.description: The Straits Times - Get exclusive stories, in-depth analyses and award-winning multimedia content about Singapore, Asia and the world.

item.title: HSA files police report over scam website of company claiming to be based in Orchard Road
item.description:
June 01, 2020 1:00 PM

SINGAPORE (THE NEW PAPER) - A medical equipment company claiming to be based in Singapore has been flagged to the authorities here as its claims appear to be part of a scam.

item.title: All pump prices down after SPC's two-week stand-off
item.description:
June 01, 2020 11:26 AM

SINGAPORE - All pump operators have adjusted their prices downwards since Esso and Shell reduced rates by around three cents last Friday.

item.title: Coronavirus: Muslim couples can make marriage vows in person from June 2 with safe distancing
item.description:
June 01, 2020 10:25 AM

SINGAPORE - Muslim couples can choose to make their marriage vows in person from Tuesday (June 2), although the number of attendees will be capped at 10 and solemnisations through video links are still encouraged.

item.title: Morning Briefing: Top stories from The Straits Times on June 1
Suspension of S'pore-KL High-Speed Rail gets final extension to Dec 31
item.description:
June 01, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore has agreed to further extend the suspension of the High-Speed Rail (HSR) project linking it and Kuala Lumpur for seven months, till the end of the year.

item.title: Enrichment programmes for children from low-income families amid Covid-19 pandemic
item.description:
June 01, 2020 5:00 AM

Enrichment programmes such as art or drama may be the norm for children during the school holidays, but not all families can afford them.

item.title: Singaporean in US with breast cancer back home
item.description:
June 01, 2020 5:00 AM

A Singaporean woman diagnosed with Stage 4 breast cancer while in the United States arrived here on Saturday night after the public raised about $373,000 to fund her trip home.

item.title: MSF-funded social services will resume in phases
item.description:
June 01, 2020 5:00 AM

A range of social services funded by the Ministry of Social and Family Development (MSF), including day centres for those with disabilities and special student care centres, will reopen in phases from tomorrow.

item.title: 'Survival kits' to engage and inspire kids from needy families during circuit breaker
item.description:
June 01, 2020 5:00 AM

It started with an idea in April to help children from needy families pass the time at home during the circuit breaker period.

item.title: A splash of colour over Marina Bay Sands
item.description:
June 01, 2020 5:00 AM

A rainbow is seen in the skies above the Marina Bay Sands area on Saturday.Â

item.title: Graduates can apply for over 11,000 traineeships from today
item.description:
June 01, 2020 5:00 AM

Graduates will be able to apply for traineeships under the SGUnited Traineeships Programme from today, Manpower Minister Josephine Teo said on Facebook yesterday.

item.title: Non-profit food delivery platform helps hawkers to go online
item.description:
June 01, 2020 5:00 AM

While Mr Jack Ong, 31, was lining up to buy chwee kueh, the hawker told him that business had been bad during the circuit breaker period.

item.title: Driver sped off after police officer asked her to stop
item.description:
June 01, 2020 5:00 AM

A 21-year-old driver has been arrested after she refused to stop when asked to do so by a police officer, proceeding to drive against the flow of traffic and almost colliding with several oncoming vehicles.

item.title: NEA hawker centre stallholders to get 2 more months of rent waiver
item.description:
June 01, 2020 5:00 AM

Rental waivers will be provided to stallholders in hawker centres managed by the National Environment Agency (NEA) or NEA-appointed operators for an additional two months till August.

item.title: Free student care services to help job-hunting parents
item.description:
June 01, 2020 5:00 AM

To help ease the financial burden of parents who have lost their jobs, two student care centres here are offering three months' worth of student care services for free.

item.title: Employers seeking levy rebates must let MOM deploy foreign workers
item.description:
June 01, 2020 5:00 AM

Employers here will have to let the Ministry of Manpower (MOM) move their foreign workers to different dormitories or work at another company in need of manpower, in order to get the foreign worker levy rebates announced in last week's Fortitude Budget.

item.title: Bukit Timah welcome with care packs for foreign workers
item.description:
June 01, 2020 5:00 AM

A group of residents from Bukit Timah welcomed 1,030 foreign workers into their neighbourhood on May 20 with care packs that included food and personal care items such as bar soaps and mosquito coils.

item.title: Volunteers from all walks of life join Singapore's fight against virus
item.description:
June 01, 2020 5:00 AM

Elmer Chan, 21, has never stepped into a foreign worker dormitory. Nor does he have any healthcare or medical expertise to offer.

item.title: Shot in arm for youth-led projects to aid community
item.description:
June 01, 2020 5:00 AM

Young people planning projects to benefit the community during the Covid-19 outbreak will now be able to tap funds more easily.

item.title: Stocks of blood type AB-, AB+ and A+ at critical levels
item.description:
June 01, 2020 5:00 AM

As of last Friday, available stocks of blood type AB-, AB+ and A+ were at critical levels and A-and O-were at low levels.

item.title: Fewer fire incidents reported in first four months of this year
item.description:
June 01, 2020 5:00 AM

Firefighters responded to fewer incidents in the first four months of the year, thanks in part to the circuit breaker period that resulted in many workplaces being shut.

item.title: Finding hope and meaning in personal narratives
item.description:
June 01, 2020 5:00 AM

The Covid-19 pandemic has resulted in unprecedented changes in our lives.

item.title: Swab tests done for all nursing home residents and staff
item.description:
June 01, 2020 5:00 AM

After one round of surveillance swab tests conducted on about 13,200 residents and 9,000 staff of nursing homes, only five have tested positive for Covid-19, said the Ministry of Health (MOH).

item.title: SCDF faces more anxious calls amid evolving coronavirus situation
item.description:
June 01, 2020 5:00 AM

Anxious people fearing they have caught Covid-19 have been contacting the Singapore Civil Defence Force (SCDF), pleading for help and demanding ambulances, despite having mild symptoms.

item.title: New outfit to boost S'pore's digitalisation capabilities
item.description:
June 01, 2020 5:00 AM

To ensure no one gets left behind as Singapore becomes more digitally connected, the Government will be setting up a new digitalisation office to double down on outreach efforts to the hardest-to-reach segments of society and encourage them to adopt digital tools.

item.title: Unlike Sars, Covid-19 will be here for some time: Experts
item.description:
June 01, 2020 5:00 AM

More than 370,000 people around the world have died from Covid-19 and the toll is mounting.

item.title: Home in focus: Celebrating love and life through pixels
item.description:
June 01, 2020 5:00 AM

The very first portrait Mr Nicky Loh photographed was of his grandmother, as part of his final-year photojournalism project in Ngee Ann Polytechnic. She had dementia and he wanted to remember the way she looked before she faded away.

item.title: No ERP charges yet; rate review to resume
item.description:
June 01, 2020 5:00 AM

Motorists here will continue to have Electronic Road Pricing (ERP) charges waived at least until June 28 - after which the results of a rate review will kick in.

item.title: Free chiropractic care for workers in healthcare industry until end-July
item.description:
June 01, 2020 5:00 AM

Three chiropractic clinics will provide free consultations and treatment to healthcare workers starting tomorrow, as Singapore exits the circuit breaker period and moves into phase one of reopening.

item.title: Man divorces wife of 45 years over cats she kept
item.description:
June 01, 2020 5:00 AM

A retiree divorced his wife of 45 years because of the cats she kept, one of which had urinated on his face.

item.title: No ERP charges at all gantries until at least June 28: LTA
item.description:
June 01, 2020 5:00 AM

Electronic Road Pricing (ERP) charges at all gantries will stay suspended until at least June 28, after which new rates might take effect.

item.title: Durians galore
item.description:
June 01, 2020 5:00 AM

It was durians galore in June 1976 at the Durian Centre in Beach Road, with the fruit piled up in lorries and baskets. Wholesalers used to unload durians at the centre for sale to the public during durian season.

item.title: Some dispute cases to be offered free mediation
item.description:
June 01, 2020 5:00 AM

Selected litigants in the Supreme Court will be able to opt to undergo free mediation to resolve their disputes, under a new initiative.
